content.webTitle: CD: John Taylor, Songs and Variations

fields.headline: John Taylor, Songs and Variations
fields.bodyText: Sumptuously recorded solo album by the great British pianist and composer, featuring 11 originals. Taylor, one of the world's most sophisticated artists in his field, has latterly been influenced as much by classical as jazz - and listeners of either persuasion will find his albums pleasing to the ear. He can, however, be rather ruminative, and though many of these tracks have a pristine beauty and a remarkable subtlety of structure, they also operate in a private sphere. Close to Mars, for instance, is Bill Evans-like in its glistening top lines and languid rhythm, and the melancholy countermelody and gracefully dancing treble figures of Starting Point are a hypnotic combination. The outstanding track, though, is Fantasy, an impulsive mix of driving, low-register melody and percussive sound effects, which is worth buying the album for alone. Escapade, too, is great, its Abdullah Ibrahim chords climaxing in a thunderous rhythm. In short: the sound of a still maturing master at work.
